intro: Serratula estremadurensis, commonly known as the Extremaduran serrated wormwood, is a flowering plant native to southern Spain. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to greenish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It is often found in the regions of Extremadura and Andalusia. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
